terms.description: An educational institution where students learn about mana cultivation and other subjects. It is where Lou Yueshuang studies.
An Immortal Emperor who was previously an enemy of Mo Wuji but later sought to ally with him against the Great Sword Path. He is known for his skills in the Dao of Prophecy.
A peak grade item that is extremely valuable and can be used for various purposes in cultivation. It is found in the Yunxian Immortal Valley.
A pill that blackens the spirit roots and primordial spirit of a cultivator, rendering them unable to cultivate. It is used by captors to control their prisoners and force them into labor.

An outer disciple of the Fire Sword Summit, known for his arrogance and bullying behavior. He previously attempted to intimidate Mo Wuji and was involved in the incident that led to Fei Bingzhu's troubles.
A location where fighting is prohibited, allowing cultivators to rest and recuperate. It is a neutral ground for many factions.
A cultivation stage that Mo Wuji has reached, giving him confidence in his pill refining abilities.
A type of demonic bug found in the Mining Area of Death. They are known for their ability to invade and woodify a cultivator's spirit channels.
A significant phenomenon in the story that opens periodically, allowing cultivators to access vast resources and treasures. It is a source of conflict and competition among various races.
A platform where cultivators can settle disputes through combat. The victor claims the spoils of the loser, making it a place of high stakes and intense battles.
The former Dao Lord of the Half Immortal Domain, known for his strength and ability to defeat a Heavenly Immortal. His legacy and actions have a significant impact on the current events in the story.
An alias for Ku Xinren, one of the three Rogue Sages. He is known for his cultivation of the Laws of Darkness and his connection to the Time Plate.
Another Tier 5 Pill King from the Pill Dao Immortal Alliance who accompanies Geng Ji. He is also involved in the confrontation with Mo Wuji.
A high-grade pill that increases the chances of a Grand Luo Immortal advancing to the Immortal King Stage. It is highly sought after and valuable in the cultivation world.
A cultivation level that Mo Wuji has reached, indicating a significant increase in power and abilities. It is a crucial stage for cultivators aiming to ascend to the Immortal Realm.
A rare and valuable item that can help cultivators advance their cultivation. It is highly sought after and is considered a treasure.
A Tier 1 Mortal Pill that helps cultivators at the Channel Opening Stage increase their cultivation speed. It is one of the pills that Mo Wuji refines.
A Tier 2 Mortal Pill that can recover life energy and prevent it from dispersing. It is crucial for Yan Qianyin's survival after her encounter with the Life Sucking Beast.
A legendary sword that was once owned by Mo Luoqu, a founder of the Formless Blade Sect. Its two halves are located at the Hanging Sword Cliff and the Formless Blade Mountain.
A rare Tier 2 immortal fruit that can help Heavenly Immortal Stage cultivators advance to the Golden Immortal Stage. It is highly sought after in the auction.
A service disciple who works in the Spiritual Herbs Warehouse and is a friend of Mo Wuji. He provides valuable information and assistance to Mo Wuji throughout the story.
An organization that operates within the Corner of Yong Ying, known for its trade and auctions. It plays a significant role in the story as it interacts with Mo Wuji and his companions.
A location where a competition is to be held, which Yan Qianyin plans to attend.
A significant location within the Formless Blade Sect that has not been opened for a thousand years. It is believed to contain valuable resources and treasures for pill refiners.
A sect in the story that Mo Wuji becomes affiliated with as a guest pill refiner. It is known for its rich history and the opening of the Formless Blade Mountain.

A set of four unique items that are essential for accessing the fate of Tian Ji. Each mark corresponds to a different aspect of the fate extraction process and is crucial for any cultivator seeking to harness the power of fate.
The Heavenly Emperor of Six Paths Immortal Domain, known for his strength and authority. He is protective of his daughter and has a vested interest in Mo Wuji.
The daughter of Gai Ao, she is a talented cultivator and has a keen interest in Mo Wuji. She is one of the few characters who sees Mo Wuji's potential.
A Tier 5 Pill King from the Pill Dao Immortal Alliance. He attempts to pressure Mo Wuji into giving up his jade tokens but is ultimately thwarted.

A significant location in the story, the God Burial Cave is known for its connection to powerful treasures and the potential for great danger. It serves as a backdrop for various events and character interactions.

A vast realm where powerful cultivators reside, characterized by the presence of God Kings and the potential for immense cultivation resources. It is a place where the laws of Heaven and Earth are more complete compared to the Immortal World.

A special area within the God Domain that incubates treasures and resources for cultivators. It is known for its dangers and the potential for great rewards, but also for the risks involved in seeking those rewards.
The highest rank of cultivators in the God Domain, above the Heavenly God Stage. God Kings are powerful beings who have reached the pinnacle of cultivation and command great respect.

A form of cultivation resource that is essential for advancing to higher stages of cultivation in the God Domain. It is associated with the spiritual roots of cultivators and is crucial for their growth.
A legendary tower that opens periodically, containing treasures and opportunities for cultivators. It is a central location for many events in the story.
A Tier 4 pill that allows a cultivator to advance from the Transcending Mortality Stage to the Yuan Dan Stage. It is highly sought after for its rarity and effectiveness.
A rare and powerful dragon species known for its unique bloodline and abilities. The Gold Horn Violet Dragon is capable of immense power and is revered in the cultivation world.
Another Tier 3 spiritual herb required for the Spirit Strengthening Pill. Mo Wuji needs to acquire this herb to successfully concoct the pill.
A high level of cultivation that surpasses the Heavenly Immortal Stage. Golden Immortals are powerful beings that play a significant role in the power dynamics of the Immortal World.
A prestigious competition held in Yong Ying Immortal Domain where pill refiners compete for slots to enter the Yunxian Immortal Valley. It is a central event in the story.
An Immortal Emperor known for his tyrannical behavior and strong temper. He is a powerful figure in the Immortal World and is feared by many.
A rank of cultivation that is above the Grand Luo Immortal stage but below the Immortal King stage. It represents a significant level of power and ability.
A powerful pill refiner from the Heaven Seeking Palace, known for her skills and knowledge in alchemy. She has a close relationship with Mo Wuji and has helped him in the past.

A core treasure of the Meditation Nunnery, which is sought after by various factions, including the Great Kun Buddhist Sect. It is believed to have significant power and importance in the cultivation world.
A title given to powerful beings who have reached the Sage Stage. They are considered to be among the most formidable entities in the universe.
A powerful sect in the Immortal World known for its sword cultivation. The Great Sword Path has a reputation for being ruthless and has clashed with Mo Wuji and his allies.
A realm where cultivators reside, known for its unique laws and the presence of acute wood energy. It serves as a prison for many cultivators and is the setting for much of the story.
A powerful weapon that Mo Wuji acquires during the auction. It is a fragment of a Grade 9 immortal equipment, which Mo Wuji intends to refine and use in battle.
A magic weapon wielded by Mo Wuji, known for its formidable power. It is used in combat and is a symbol of Mo Wuji's strength as a cultivator.
A location within the sect where spiritual herbs and resources are managed and exchanged. Mo Wuji intends to visit this hall to procure the necessary herbs for his pill refinement.
A female cultivator from the Jade Lady Sect who seeks to advance to the Immortal King Stage. She is grateful to Mo Wuji for helping her and is willing to assist him in return.

A supporting character and the manor lord of the Hundred Flowers Manor, Han Qingru is a talented cultivator who has condensed her immortal lattice. She has a close relationship with Mo Wuji and is determined to help him.
A cliff within the Formless Blade Sect where the other half of the Fallen Tune Sword is located. It is known for its dangerous gravitational pull and is a place of legend.
A Tier 7 antidote immortal pill that can counteract certain poisons. It is a valuable item for cultivators who may encounter toxic environments.
A prominent organization in the story that serves as a cultivation holy land. It is known for its powerful disciples and significant influence in the Five Great Empires.

A significant location in the story, the Heaven's Beyond Corridor serves as a passageway where various races converge to seek cultivation resources. It is known for its dangers and the constant battles that occur within.
A level of cultivation that is below Golden Immortal. It is a significant stage for many characters in the story, including Mo Wuji and his companions.

A sect in the God Domain that has recently been rebuilt after suffering significant losses. It is characterized by its emphasis on unity and the potential for growth, especially with the emergence of a God King.
A powerful magic treasure belonging to Meng Tianyu, capable of manipulating acute wood energy. It was previously taken by Mo Wuji during their confrontation.
A powerful sect in the Immortal World that is known for its strength and influence. It is one of the factions that Mo Wuji must contend with.
A secret location where dragon race geniuses cultivate. It is said to contain a path to the Immortal World and is protected by powerful arrays.
A Tier 8 immortal fruit that can be used to concoct the Immortal Channel Nirvana Pill. It is a valuable item that can heal the spirit channels of Immortal Kings.
A Tier 3 spiritual herb used in the concoction of the Spirit Strengthening Pill. It is one of the essential ingredients that Mo Wuji needs to gather for his pill refinement.
A vast and dangerous chasm that separates the Half Immortal Domain from the Immortal Realm. It is filled with various dangers and is a key location in the story.
A high rank of cultivation in the Immortal World, representing a powerful and respected figure. Immortal Kings have significant influence and abilities.
A powerful array that traps cultivators within it, preventing them from escaping. It is a significant obstacle that Mo Wuji must navigate.
A staircase that allows cultivators to ascend to the Immortal World. It is a significant plot point as Mo Wuji and his companions aim to use it to escape to the Immortal World.
A battleship forged by Master Pu Zi, designed to traverse the Immortal Chasm and reach the Immortal Realm. It is equipped with various cannons and defensive arrays.
A supporting character who works with Mo Wuji and Master Pu Zi. She is knowledgeable about the Half Immortal Domain and has been digging for blackstones.

An envoy of the Very High Heavens who oversees the gathering of sect heads and powerful cultivators. He is responsible for maintaining order and discussing important matters within the Immortal World.

A disciple of the Heavenly Mortal Sect, Ku Cai possesses dark spiritual roots and is a character who seeks to cultivate and improve her abilities. She is portrayed as someone who is vulnerable yet determined to find her place in the world.
A supporting character who is also a cultivator from the Half Immortal Domain. She has a strong connection with Mo Wuji and helps him during their journey.
The Heavenly Emperor of Yong Ying Immortal Domain, who presides over the Grand Alchemy Competition. He is a powerful figure who aims to promote the status of various immortal cities.
A legendary sword that is known for its immense power and ability to cut through almost anything. It is a significant weapon in Mo Wuji's arsenal and plays a crucial role in his journey.
A character who is one of the three Rogue Sages and a former ally of Mo Wuji. He possesses a Tao Tie Pot and has a complicated relationship with the other characters in the story.
The manager of the He Lian Merchant House in Ying Bian City, Lao Cai is a powerful Golden Immortal who seeks to control the Hundred Flowers Manor and covets Han Qingru.
A Tier 3 spiritual herb required for the Spirit Strengthening Pill according to the Wordless Pill manual.
A character who was married to Yu Jingshan's brother. She is a kind-hearted woman who has faced many hardships and is now a late Grand Luo Immortal.
A demonic beast known for its ability to drain life force from living beings. It poses a significant threat to cultivators and is a central element in Yan Qianyin's quest.
A Tier 3 spiritual herb required for the Spirit Strengthening Pill according to the Wordless Pill manual.
A notorious figure in the underground market of the Half Immortal Domain. He is known for his arrogance and has a strong desire for power.
A location in the story that is known for its treasures and dangers. It is a battlefield where cultivators seek to find valuable items, including the Sky Channel Flower.
The location where Mo Wuji is currently situated, which is part of the sect he is associated with. It is significant as it is where he conducts his pill refining activities.
A character from Zhen Xing who is a Star Lord and a friend of Mo Wuji. He has been heavily injured by Meng Tianyu and is grateful for Mo Wuji's help.
A supporting character who has been through hardships in the Heaven's Beyond Corridor. She is a cultivator who has been forced to navigate the dangers of the area and has a connection with Mo Wuji.
A hall within An Jing Academy where students undergo assessments for mana cultivation. It is the setting for Lou Yueshuang's advanced class assessment.
A peerless smith in the Half Immortal Domain who has a deep understanding of smithing and array dao. He was involved in the forging of a battleship and is a key ally to Mo Wuji.
The organization or group that Yan Qianyin is associated with.
The head of the Immortal Seeking Union, known for his ruthless tactics and ability to manipulate acute wood energy. He has a personal vendetta against Mo Wuji.

An organization that operates within the Heaven's Beyond City Square, known for selling pills and magic treasures. It has a reputation for being powerful and influential, but has recently faced challenges from Mo Wuji's Mortal Pill House.
A dangerous mining area within the Half Immortal Domain, filled with Colourless Leeches and other threats. It is known for its rich deposits of blackstone.

The number one sect in the Hai Yi Continent, known for its powerful Rogue Immortals and its connection to the Immortal World. It has a reputation for being ruthless and is involved in the blood sacrifice of its disciples.

The protagonist of the story, Mo Wuji is a talented cultivator who has advanced through various stages of cultivation and is known for his skills in pill refining and array mastery. He is determined to establish his own sect, Ping Fan, and seeks to avenge his friends.
A unique cultivation path that Mo Wuji follows, focusing on the principles of mortality and the natural world. It allows him to cultivate without the constraints typically faced by other cultivators.
A disciple of Qi Junyi from the Lightning Sect. He is involved in the pursuit of Su Xi and Yuan Yi.
A cultivation stage where cultivators can form the true primordial spirit and use spiritual will.
The ancestor of the Heavenly Mortal Sect and a newly ascended God King. Pang Jie is a pivotal figure in the sect's revival and is respected by the disciples for his strength and leadership.
A place within the Cape of Peace where no fighting is allowed. It serves as a refuge for cultivators and is known for its high fees.
A valuable material that is sought after for its unique properties and potential uses in cultivation. It is considered a supreme treasure of fortune.
An influential organization in the novel that governs pill refiners and their practices. It plays a significant role in the alchemy competition.
An organization within the Heaven Seeking Palace that focuses on pill refining. It is known for its high standards and the expertise of its members.

Ping Fan is the sect established by Mo Wuji, aiming to create a place where all beings, regardless of their status, are treated equally. It is characterized by its rich immortal energy and a focus on cultivating both mortals and immortals.
A rogue cultivator and one of Mo Wuji's friends. He is strong and has a good sense of loyalty, willing to fight alongside Mo Wuji.
An elder of the Lightning Sect and a powerful Immortal Reverent. He is involved in the conflict with Mo Wuji and is known for his ruthless nature.

The provincial capital of Kai Nam Province, Qi Shu City is a medium-sized city that serves as a central location for various events, including the Three Star Exam. It is known for its rich history and cultural significance.
A legendary treasure known for its immense power and ability to enhance cultivation. It is highly sought after by cultivators and is said to be capable of aiding in significant breakthroughs.
A technique that Mo Wuji discovers hidden within the Fallen Tune Sword. It is a cultivation technique that allows for the manipulation of spiritual energy.
A Tier 3 spiritual herb collected by Mo Wuji from the Formless Blade Mountain.

A powerful talisman belonging to the Talisman Race, the Sage Dao Talisman is said to contain numerous peak-grade talismans and is crucial for the survival of the Talisman Race. It is a key item that Mo Wuji seeks to refine.
A powerful figure in the story, the Sage Nun is one of the 8 Sages and is known for her wisdom and strength. She has a significant influence over the events in the God World.
Mo Wuji's acquaintance and a member of the Tian Ji Sect. She is determined to help Mo Wuji in rebuilding the sect.
A unique fire technique used by Mo Wuji, capable of burning through various materials and providing protection against Colourless Leeches. It is a key part of his combat abilities.
A powerful organization in the Immortal World that engages in trade and commerce. It is known for its ruthless tactics and has a reputation for imprisoning those who offend it.
A lightning affinity technique that Mo Wuji developed. It allows the user to absorb lightning essence and is crucial for his cultivation.
A pet bird of Mo Wuji, who possesses the bloodline of a Bloodthirsty Black Mosquito. Shuai Guo is characterized by its humorous personality and its ability to absorb blood.
A rare spiritual herb that is essential for opening the 100th spirit channel. It is sought after by cultivators for its unique properties.
The largest sea in the Five Great Empires, known for its vastness and the dangers it holds. It is the setting for many adventures and conflicts.
An antidote pill that is effective against nerve poisons. It is a valuable item that Mo Wuji acquires during his journey.
A valuable fruit that can cleanse a cultivator's spiritual roots. It is highly sought after for its ability to restore one's cultivation potential.
A significant location within the Six Paths Ruins where souls can be condensed and revived. It is linked to the Underworld and is crucial for Mo Wuji's quest to save Cen Shuyin.
A Tier 6 immortal herb that can be used to brew tea or wine to strengthen a cultivator's soul. It is mentioned in the context of Shi Gulan's illness.
A powerful weapon used by the bisexual Immortal Reverent Ji Qi. It has the ability to attack and damage the primordial spirit of its opponents.

A Tier 3 spiritual pill that is capable of increasing the soul force of the spiritual will of low-level cultivators. It is essential for those who wish to strengthen their spiritual will and improve their cultivation abilities.
A disciple of the Meditation Nunnery and Yuan Yi's apprentice. After her master’s death, she becomes reliant on Mo Wuji for protection and guidance.
A notorious prison within the Great Sword Path where prisoners are subjected to extreme torture by sword qi. It is said that no one has ever survived after being imprisoned there.
A river located near the Vine Mountain of Safety, filled with dangerous sword qi. The water from this river is said to have healing properties for those who can withstand its toxicity.
A Tier 4 Pill King who is a friend of Wen Lianxi's family. He is supportive and has a good character, often helping the Water Ying Immortal City.
A location that serves as a link between the Immortal World and the God World. It is known for its dangers and the presence of powerful beings.

An examination conducted by the Joint Space Navigation Federation that tests the abilities of students aspiring to go to Planet Diyuan. It consists of a theory portion and a practical portion, with a high level of difficulty.

An ancient existence associated with the extraction of fate from the Immortal World. The term refers to a primordial fate that can be harnessed for immense power and is linked to the Four Marks of Tian Ji.
A supporting character who is a friend of Mo Wuji and also a cultivator from the Half Immortal Domain. He has advanced to the Heavenly Immortal Stage and is loyal to Mo Wuji.

A powerful Tier 9 immortal pill that allows an Immortal Reverent to step into the Immortal Emperor Stage. It is highly sought after and considered a significant treasure for those looking to advance their cultivation.
A rare Tier 9 immortal herb used to condense souls and revive them. It is crucial for Mo Wuji's goal of saving Cen Shuyin.
The nickname of the leader of the Black Tailed Bees, a gang of horse bandits. He is known for his cruelty and is a target of revenge for Mo Wuji's allies.
A safe haven within the Sword Prison where the sword qi is weaker. It is a place where cultivators can find temporary refuge from the dangers of the Sword Prison.
A Grand Emperor and one of Mo Wuji's allies. He plays a significant role in the establishment and protection of Ping Fan.
A character who is the daughter of the castellan of Water Ying Immortal City. She is a kind-hearted individual who seeks to help her mother and is grateful to Mo Wuji for his assistance.
A manual that contains various pill formulas, including those for Tier 3 pills. It serves as an important resource for Mo Wuji in his quest to become a better pill refiner.
A notorious group of horse bandits known for their ruthlessness and strength. They are responsible for many atrocities in the region.

The daughter of the previous Manor Lord of the Lightning Sword Manor, Xi Nianmo is a strong-willed character who is determined to reclaim her position and avenge her family's honor. She is also portrayed as having a close relationship with Mo Wuji.

A powerful family known for their control over the body tempering fluid and their influence in the Space Navigation Federation. The Xia Clan has a long history and is considered one of the top families on Earth.

A prestigious university located in Qi Shu City, known for its focus on cultivating talented individuals. It is one of the top twenty schools in the country and serves as a hub for aspiring cultivators.
Wen Lianxi's mother, who has been ill for many years. She is protective of her daughter and shows concern for her well-being.

A character who plays a significant role in Mo Wuji's journey, Yan Qianyin provides him with spiritual herbs and a fragmentary pill formula to aid in his development as a pill refiner. She is also a skilled cultivator with her own ambitions.
A location where a significant battle took place between the Hundred Sect Alliance and the alien cultivators. It is known for its dark history and the presence of powerful entities.
A diagram used in arrays, representing the balance of yin and yang. It is often used in various techniques and formations within the cultivation world.

A significant location in the story, Ying Bian City is the largest city in the Corner of Yong Ying and serves as a hub for trade and power. It is governed by powerful cultivators and is a place where many conflicts arise.
An important region in the novel where the Grand Alchemy Competition takes place. It is known for its powerful figures and the Yunxian Immortal Valley.
The grandfather of Yu Jingfeng and the guardian of Lian Yingxian. He has a strong moral character and cares deeply for his family.
Yu Cheng's grandson and Lian Yingxian's brother-in-law. He is a fisherman who aspires to cultivate and is deeply loyal to his family.
The master of Su Xi and a powerful figure from the Meditation Nunnery. She is known for her strength and her connection to the Great Kun Buddhist Lamp.
A prominent resthouse in Yong Ying Immortal Domain where many cultivators gather. It serves as a temporary accommodation for Mo Wuji and others.
A mystical valley that is known for its abundance of high-tier immortal herbs. It is a coveted location for cultivators seeking rare resources.
A Tier 5 immortal pill that is used to condense spiritual will and enhance the primordial spirit. It is a key item for certain cultivators.
A character who is part of Mo Wuji's group and has a kind personality. She is a rogue cultivator and has been saved by Mo Wuji.
An Immortal King and ally of Mo Wuji. He is a significant figure in the Immortal World and is sought after for his strength and wisdom.
